item.title: Best Counter-Strike Players To Watch in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-counter-strike-players-to-watch-in-2025/

Counter-Strike players in 2025 will have the opportunity to capitalize on an entirely new landscape. Following post-Major roster changes and new rules implemented by Valve, the competitive CS2 scene will feel drastically different compared to years past.

Many of the same players who dominated the 2024 season will almost certainly do so again in 2025. Obviously you should be watching established greats like donk, m0NESY, ZywOo, and others next year. But rather than highlight the best players of 2024 who will repeat success again next year, we’re going to look at players ready to break into the top echelon.

Best CS2 Players to Watch in 2025

Mario “malbsMd” Samayoa

With long-time rifler Nikola “NiKo” Kovač set to depart for Falcons, G2 is looking to Argentinian rising star malbsMd to step up another level. malbsMd was brought in from North American roster M80 this past summer and made an immediate impact on G2. He showcased his star capabilities at some of the biggest events of the year, including the recent Shanghai Major. NiKo has big shoes to fill, but with G2 also reportedly holding on to superstar AWPer Ilya “m0NESY” Osipov, malbsMd is in a great position to take a huge leap forward.

Roland “ultimate” Tomkowiak

There’s no shortage of incredible AWPers in CS2, and Team Liquid’s ultimate looks primed and ready to reach that top tier. Liquid grabbed ultimate from the Polish roster of Illuminar Gaming this past year, and outside of IEM Rio and the final BLAST events, he’s been splendid. At his first ever Major, he was a bright spot during Liquid’s playoff run, providing incredible value as both an AWPer and a secondary entry player.

Dorian “xertioN” Berman

The current MOUZ lineup is absolutely stacked with young talent, but xertioN gets the nod here. The Israeli 20-year-old player is a prolific main entry player, with an ability to properly utilize utility in a way that’s invaluable to MOUZ. MOUZ made a number of deep playoff runs this year, and won ESL Pro League Season 19, thanks to spectacular play from xertioN. Since his return from a VAC ban, Jimi “Jimpphat” Salo has also been spectacular for MOUZ.

Who else is worth watching when the CS2 2025 season begins? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

If you’ve got spare CSGO or CS2 skins and you’re feeling lucky, check out Clash.gg (18+ only)

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE – Year 2 Content is Planned for Ubisoft’s Skull and Bones
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/skull-and-bones-year-2/

Ubisoft plans to release year 2 content for its quadruple A game Skull and Bones.

That’s according to sources who have knowledge of the plans for the pirate action-adventure game.

Year 2 Season 1 is set to kick off sometime early next year with brand-new PvP gamemodes, places of interest (POIs), new world tiers, and more.

It’s also understood that Ubisoft is exploring more premium crossover events, with one source saying that one idea includes a Black Flag crossover event around the time of the release of Assassin’s Creed Black Flag Remake (codenamed Obsidian). But whether or not that comes to fruition remains to be seen.

The news that Skull and Bones will be having Year 2 of content might surprise some, as the publisher recently canceled XDefiant, its free-to-play offering that saw nearly 300 people lose their jobs.

However, sources tell me that Ubisoft is fully committed to continuing the game’s support and that the player numbers “might surprise people.” Still, Insider Gaming could not verify the game’s current player count statistics. At the time of writing, though, Skull and Bones get just shy of a peak of 200 concurrent players in 24 hours on Steam, according to SteamDB.

The game is currently slashed from its £49.99 price tag to just £20.00 on the Ubisoft store page, with the publisher also offering a 6-hour free demo for those on PC should you wish to try.

Earlier this year, Insider Gaming reported that one week after the games release Skull and Bones saw an estimated 850,000 players, which also included those who had played via Ubisoft’s free 8-hour game trial.

What do you think of Skull and Bones nearly a year on? Will you be giving Year 2 content a go? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that a STALKER TV adaptation might be inbound

item.title: What’s Included in Project Zomboid Build 42?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/whats-included-in-project-zomboid-build-42/

For those of us still actively playing Project Zomboid and eagerly awaiting the launch of Build 42, some good news finally arrived from developer The Indie Stone. Project Zomboid Build 42 is officially on the unstable branch, available to download and play now, but with a few caveats. First and foremost, it’s only available in unstable as a work in progress, and the build does not work with current saves or mods, so clear your files!

Everything Added to Project Zomboid in Build 42 (Unstable)

Build 42 is positively massive, with so much new content that ensures Zomboid feels like an entirely new game. We have an expanded map with new locations and towns, underground zones, better lighting, a new build menu, lore, wild animals, crafting mechanics, and performance optimizations, to name but a few of the big changes!

  • Expanded Map
  • Additional Towns & Locations
  • Underground Areas
  • Basements
  • High Rise Buildings
  • New Lighting System
  • Darker Nights
  • Performance Optimizations
  • Animal Husbandry – Cows, Pigs, Sheep, and Chickens
  • Wild Animals – Deer, Rats, and Rabbits
  • Fishing Mechanics
  • Expanded Lore – Newspapers, Flyers, Television, and Radio
  • New Building Menu
  • Initial Crafting – New UI, Surface Crafting, Pottery, and Blacksmith Tech Trees
  • Improved Agriculture and Crops
  • Dynamic Music
  • Player Vocals
  • New Clothing, Containers, Weapons, and Objects
  • Better UI Scaling
  • Randomized Wilderness and Biomes
  • Basic Tracking and Hunting Mechanics
  • New Seated Animations
  • Better Gunplay
  • Corpse Dragging
  • Window Chucking
  • Romero-like Zombie Spawns
  • Improved Sneaking
  • Combat Balancing
  • Environmental Story Improvements

What’s Coming to Build 42?

Well, that’s quite a lot available on the unstable branch, but it’s only the beginning for Build 42!

  • Expanded Crafting
  • Additional Skills
  • New Professions
  • Improved Hunting
  • Breakable Metal Fencing
  • Multiplayer Reintroduction
  • Raccoons
  • And more (???)

What are you most looking forward to from Build 42 in Project Zomboid? Let us know in the comments below, or visit the community forum to discuss the ultimate zombie survival game with others!

If you love zombies as much as we do, don’t forget to check out how to unlock Mustang & Sally in Black Ops 6 Zombies!
